name: Torsten Seemann
body:
### About

A/Prof. Torsten Seemann is an bioinformatician at 
[The University of Melbourne](http://www.unimelb.edu.au/) in Australia. 
He specialises in tools and methods for analysing bacterial genomics data.

* Publications: [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=PuH3Yp4AAAAJ&view_op=list_works)
* Blog: [The Genome Factory](http://TheGenomeFactory.blogspot.com/)
* Software: [GitHub](https://github.com/tseemann/)

### Affiliations
* [Victorian Life Sciences Computation Initiative](http://www.vlsci.org.au/)
* [Doherty Centre for Applied Microbial Genomics](http://www.doherty.edu.au/)
* [Microbiological Diagnostics Unit Public Health Laboratory](http://www.mduphl.unimelb.edu.au/)

### Collaborators
* [A/Prof Tim Stinear](http://www.microbiol.unimelb.edu.au/new_research/microbiology/stinear_novo.html)
* [Prof Ben Howden](http://www.microbiol.unimelb.edu.au/new_research/microbiology/howden.html)
* [A/Prof David Powell](http://thunking.drp.id.au/)

### Software
* [Prokka](https://github.com/tseemann/prokka)
* [Snippy](https://github.com/tseemann/snippy)
* [MLST](https://github.com/tseemann/mlst)
* [Abricate](https://github.com/tseemann/abricate)

### Contact
* [Email](mailto:torsten.seemann@gmail.com)
* Twitter: [@torstenseemann](https://twitter.com/torstenseemann)
